content: *marla and sami collection* marla 1 is made from 2 strands of lighter-weight yarn that have been dyed separately and then plied together when worked marla creates a marled fabric where the colors are uniquely distributed sami 2 the semi-solid dk-weight sister to marla has a palette of 11 coordinating colors this doughnut cowl has no wrong side it begins with a solid area of one color then changes to a small geometric stranded pattern for awhile then moves to the other color on its own and finally repeats the stranded pattern the solid areas give the eye a place to rest as well as highlighting each yarn individually ||||||| sizes 26 finished circumference x 7½ deep materials manos del uruguay sami 100% superwash merino wool approx 273yds / 100g 1 skip manos del uruguay marla 100% superwash merino wool approx 273yds / 100g 1 skip shown in sami y2150 bing cherry a and marla k201 tabac b us 4/3 5mm 16 circular needle or size needed to obtain gauge in stockinette us 6/4mm 16 circular needle or size needed to obtain gauge in stranded colorwork spare us 4/3 5mm 16 circular needle or smaller for closing graft 1 stitch marker crochet hook for provisional cast-on g/4mm tapestry needle waste yarn gauge 26 stitches and 37 rounds = 4 in stockinette st on size us4/3 5mm 26 stitches and 70 rounds = 4 in stranded colorwork on size us6/4mm abbreviations bor beginning of round co cast on cont continue k knit ndl s needles s repeat s repeats s round s round s st s stitch es wy waste yarn notes this cowl is started with a provisional cast-on and knit in the round making a long tube when complete the two ends of the tube are brought together and grafted creating a seamless closure 1 https //fairmountfibers com/products/marla 2 https //fairmountfibers com/collections/yarns/products/sami
